name: Common Order
description: The Common Order segment (ORC) is used to transmit fields that are common to all orders (laboratory, radiology, pharmacy, dietary, supply, etc.). The ORC segment is paired with the order detail segment (e.g., OBR, RXO, RXE) to create a complete order. It provides order control information and identifies the placer and filler applications.

cardinality.note: ORC segment is required when order information is present

ORC.1.name: Order Control
ORC.1.description: This field contains the order control code that identifies the function of the order segment. Values from HL7 Table 0119 - order control codes.

validValues.description: Response to send order status request
Link order to patient care problem or goal
Unlink order from patient care problem or goal

ORC.1.generationHint: Most common: NW (new order), CA (cancel), DC (discontinue), RP (replace)

ORC.2.name: Placer Order Number
ORC.2.description: This field is the order number associated with the placing application. This is a unique identifier for the order as assigned by the system placing the order (the placer).

ORC.3.name: Filler Order Number
ORC.3.description: This field is the order number associated with the filling application. This is assigned by the system filling the order (the filler) and may be different from the placer order number.

ORC.4.name: Placer Group Number
ORC.4.description: This field identifies a group of orders assigned by the placer application. All orders in the group share this common identifier.

ORC.5.name: Order Status
ORC.5.description: This field defines the status of the order. Values from HL7 Table 0038 - order status.

validValues.description: Some, but not all, results available

ORC.5.generationHint: Common statuses: SC (scheduled), IP (in process), CM (complete), CA (cancelled)

ORC.6.name: Response Flag
ORC.6.description: This field identifies the response required from the receiving system. Values from HL7 Table 0121 - response flag.

validValues.description: Same as E, also Replacement and Parent-Child
Same as R, also other associated segments
Same as D, plus confirmations explicitly
Only the MSA segment is returned

ORC.6.generationHint: Most common: E (exceptions), F (full confirmation), N (MSA only)

ORC.7.name: Quantity/Timing
ORC.7.description: This field contains the quantity and timing of the order. This is a complex field that specifies how much and how often.

ORC.8.name: Parent
ORC.8.description: This field identifies the parent order when the current order is a child order. Contains the placer order number of the parent.

ORC.9.name: Date/Time of Transaction
ORC.9.description: This field contains the date and time when the order transaction occurred. This is when the order was placed, modified, or status changed.
ORC.9.generationHint: Format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS, typically current timestamp for order transactions

ORC.10.name: Entered By
ORC.10.description: This field identifies the person who entered the order. Uses extended composite ID number and name format for the ordering provider or clerk.

ORC.11.name: Verified By
ORC.11.description: This field identifies the person who verified the order. This may be different from the person who entered the order.
ORC.11.generationHint: Verifying provider format, similar to ORC.10

ORC.12.name: Ordering Provider
ORC.12.description: This field identifies the provider who is responsible for the order. This is the primary ordering physician or clinician.
ORC.12.generationHint: Primary ordering provider, critical for pharmacy and lab orders

ORC.13.name: Enterer's Location
ORC.13.description: This field identifies the location where the order was entered. Uses point of care location format.

ORC.14.name: Call Back Phone Number
ORC.14.description: This field contains the phone number to call for questions about the order. Multiple phone numbers may be specified.

ORC.15.name: Order Effective Date/Time
ORC.15.description: This field contains the date and time when the order becomes effective. This may be different from when the order was placed.
ORC.15.generationHint: When order should start, may be future date for scheduled orders

ORC.16.name: Order Control Code Reason
ORC.16.description: This field contains the reason for the order control code. Explains why an order was cancelled, discontinued, etc.
ORC.16.generationHint: Free text or coded reason for order control action

ORC.17.name: Entering Organization
ORC.17.description: This field identifies the organization where the order was entered. Uses extended composite name and ID format for organizations.
ORC.17.generationHint: Organization identifier and name where order originated

ORC.18.name: Entering Device
ORC.18.description: This field identifies the device or system used to enter the order. This could be a workstation, mobile device, or application identifier.
ORC.18.generationHint: Device/system identifier: CPOE^Computerized Provider Order Entry^LOCAL

ORC.19.name: Action By
ORC.19.description: This field identifies the person who performed the action specified by the order control code (e.g., who cancelled the order).
ORC.19.generationHint: Person who performed the order control action

notes: ORC segment is required when order detail segments (OBR, RXO, etc.) are present
ORC.1 (Order Control) is required and drives the order workflow
Either ORC.2 (Placer) or ORC.3 (Filler) order number should be present for identification
ORC.12 (Ordering Provider) is critical for clinical responsibility and billing
Order status progression: NW → SC → IP → CM (or CA/DC for cancelled/discontinued)
Parent-child relationships (ORC.8) are used for complex multi-part orders

conditional.ORC.2: Required for new orders from placer application
conditional.ORC.3: Required for order responses from filler application
conditional.ORC.12: Should be provided for clinical orders requiring provider identification
conditional.ORC.16: Should be provided when ORC.1 indicates cancellation, discontinuation, or modification

relationships.ORC.1_ORC.5: Order control code and status should be logically consistent
relationships.ORC.2_ORC.3: At least one order number should be present for order tracking
relationships.ORC.1_ORC.16: Control code reason should align with control action

validation.ORC.1: Must be valid HL7 Table 0119 order control code
validation.ORC.5: Must be valid HL7 Table 0038 order status code
validation.ORC.6: Must be valid HL7 Table 0121 response flag code
